text: Hi everyone today
today I'm gonna share with you an amazing vegan recipe is a green summer roll with very delicious vegetarian
fillings. I tried for the first time in a vegan restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City and was amazed how good it turns out
So I gave it a try at home and today I decided to share this recipe with you. Let's begin!
You will need :1 block of tofu wrapped in a few layers of kitchen towels to draw out the excess moisture
Cut into steak around  half an inch thick
Heat a generous amount of vegetable oil in the pan
Enough to cover the tofu steaks and then gently drop them in and deep fry till golden brown on both sides
When the tofu is nicely golden on both sides
You're gonna take them out and drain off the excess oil let cool completely before cutting into long sticks like this
you also need 50 grams of dried wood ear mushrooms to soak in water for about 15 minutes to soften and then
Cut into strips like this
You want to shred half a carrot into fine shreds  and mix it with a teaspoon of sugar and a tablespoon of vinegar
Mix well and let sit for about 10 minutes and you will have a sweet and sour pickles
Now heat 2 tbsp of vegetable oil in a wok and then saute the minced leeks  or boaro the white part only
Until quite golden
When it's nicely golden and fragrant you can add the other half of the carrot which I have also cut into sticks
Saute for about 2 to 3 minutes until soft then add the shredded wood ear mushrooms
Feel free to use other kinds of mushrooms that you like
Now season with sugar and mushroom powder about 1/2 a teaspoon each and 1/4 TSP of salt
Stir really well
Then add the tofu and toss well just toss like this and do not stir because you don't want to break the tofu
Then turn off the heat and let cool
To add some starchy ingredients into the fillings
You can steam or boil 2 sweet
Potatoes until soft then peel and cut into sticks around the size of a french fries
This is vegetarian ham is made from bean curd you can probably buy this frozen at Asian store
Also cut into the same size as the sweet potatoes
now boil some water and blanch a bunch of green onions or garlic chive flower for just about 30 seconds and then
Soak in cold water to maintain the green color. We will use this as the string to tie the rolls.
As the wrapper you're gonna need mustard leaves
You have to buy the same kind as what I'm buying here because it can be eaten raw
For smaller leaves we can use just the upper part for bigger ones. You can split in half and remove the stem
Now we have all the ingredients ready for the roll the stir-fried mushroom with tofu,
the sweet potato sticks, the vegetarian ham
You also need some rice vermicelli and some fresh herbs like mint or basil
Now to roll place a piece of mustard green on a flat surface like a cutting board
Remember to face the dark side down if you place the dark side up is very easy to tear
Now add a little bit of everything some rice vermicelli, a stick of sweet potatoes, a stick of vegan
Ham, some carrot pickles and some fresh herbs roll it nice and tight then use one green onion leaf
as the string and tie it up nicely roll a few of them and then place them next to each other and trim off the ends
Then we'll have very pretty even rolls
To make the sauce heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan and fry the white part of spring onion or leek  minced until
golden and fragrant then add four tablespoons of
Fermented soybean sauce or "Tương bần" you can also use "tương cự đà"
4 TSP of sugar to balance out the saltiness and a tablespoon of peanut butter
this will add some nutty creamy flavor to the sauce and also as a thickener
Also add half a cup of water and bring it to a boil simmer for about 1 to 2 minutes until it thickens
Transfer to a serving bowl and add 4 tbsp of white sesame seeds
Which should be roasted until golden and then roughly crushed
Remember to add some minced chilies to add some heat wow the sauce looks so good
Indeed the deciding factor for the success of this dish
Now it time to taste my favorite part of the video
Mmm, the roll is so fresh. Let's dip it in the sauce
The sauce is so creamy rich and nutty and fragrant, that pickled carrot
give it a nice tangy taste, the mustard greens so fresh you have every ingredients in one bite
Amazing if all vegetarian food can taste this good
I can definitely go vegan. This recipe together with so many other Phở and noodle recipes
Can be found in my cookbook
Simply Phở which is available now on Amazon and our other bookstores on and offline
You can click on the link to grab one now if you haven't already
Otherwise just click Subscribe and turn on the bell button. So you won't miss my next video when it comes out. Thank you for watching!
